Optimal incubation times may vary for particular substrates. Typical reaction conditions are as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"c24eu","text":"PNGase F is the most effective enzymatic method for removing almost allN-linked oligosaccharides from glycoproteins. PNGase F is an amidase, which cleaves between the innermost GlcNAc and asparagine residues of high mannose, hybrid, and complex oligosaccharides. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":71,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vj7n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkldc","text":"This is a generic PNGase F protocol for denaturing reaction conditions. It is appropriate for both P0704 and P0708. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":99,"length":5},{"key":1,"offset":109,"length":5}],"data":{}},{"key":"2drn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvb9c","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ertp7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D00D7146C61D11EA92280A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/p0704-pngase-f"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D00D71E1C61D11EA92280A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/p0708-pngase-f-recombinant"}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"E84FB330C61D11EA9D59810050C2D152","height":343,"id":208004,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmeg9nan.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmee9nan.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmef9nan.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmed9nan.webp","width":550}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"46k95","text":"If using P0704/P0708, we recommend limiting PNGase F to 1/10 (or less) of the total reaction volume to keep the final glycerol concentration equal to (or less than) 5%.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":5},{"key":1,"offset":15,"length":5}],"data":{}},{"key":"2bkb5","text":"For unit conversion between different suppliers, please reference the Glycobiology Unit Conversion Chart page.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":70,"length":34}],"data":{}},{"key":"956rt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5sse","text":"Biology Unit Conversion Chart","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f2k6","text":"Reagent companies differ in how a unit of enzyme is defined. This chart can be used to help determine how a unit of enzyme from one company compares to a unit of enzyme from NEB.
